Posts.Content: mom2girls wrote: Hi everyone, I just joined the group and you all seem like such a lovely bunch of women.  I am a 31 year old mom to 2 wonderful little girls ages 1 and 5.  I just had my yearly gyn appointment on 6-24-08.  During the routine breast exam the Nurse Practioner found a lump in my right breast towards the bottom directly under my nipple.  I have felt some  bumpy lumps periodically.  And have had an occassional twinge of discomfort.   With breastfeeding both of my girls my breasts have changed drastically.  The NP said I have "fibrocystic changes"  and not to worry. From what I have read that is a widely used term.  She said I should come back in a month after my cylce and they will check it and see if it is still there. I am going to try and get in earlier with a doctor.  Because I am now at the point where I am living in fear of what might lie ahead of me.   Pretty much anytime I am alone I cry.  I am just so worried that something awful is about to happen. I know the NP said not to "worry", because I am young and have no history of breast cancer.  I of course am consumed with fear and emotion. Because I know there are so many of you who were probably told the same thing.  I wanted to go into my next appointment armed with information.  Because the way I see it is either the doctor will say, it's just fibrosystic changes or I need further testing.  I really want to be aggressive in this and would love any information about what I should suggest as far as testing.  MRI, mammogram or ultrasound, biopsy?  What if they tell me I'm fine but I want more testing to be sure in a year from now I don't  find out my "nothing" really is "something".   Will they allow me to have any tests even if they don't think it's necessary? I appreciate any adive, Jessica Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 01:25PM mom2girls wrote: CallyAnn, I will be thinking about you as you wait for your results.  Thank you for your advice and for sharing your expierences with me. Jessica
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2008 05:18PM mom2girls wrote: Hi everyone, So, I have a new question as of the last few days I started expierencing underarm pain.  Mostly on my  right side where they found the lump in my breast.  The Nurse Practioner said I have Fibrosystic changes (I'm not so sure).  Is underarm pain common with that?  I have to go back July 24th to recheck the lump with a doctor.  I was wondering if I should call the doctor's office and let them know about the pain I am having or just wait til the 24th? Thanks, Jessica
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 01:06PM mom2girls wrote: Hi Cally Ann, Thank you for your advice.  You ladies have been a lifesaver today! I did read and hear that about caffeine and chocolate.  I also read taking vitamin E, can help reduce the lumpiness.  I am 5 days out from my period and the lump is still there.  But, I have stopped drinking/eating caffeine.  So hopefully, if it's fib. changes this will help decrease the lumpiness. It's  been about 7 months since I stopped nursing.  So you had an ultrasound and they were able to tell the lumps were fibrocystic?  Did you have to have a biopsy also?  I just have this feeling the dr. is going to feel it and say, "Oh you're fine just fib. changes"  and then in a year from now it'll be a different story.  But, I think that is the anxiety talking.    Jessica
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 11:51AM - edited Jun 29, 2008 11:54AM by mom2girls Thank you very much to the three of you.  I am sitting here now while my little ones are napping and my husband is golfing and my mind is racing.  I feel comfort in knowing that you all have been in the "waiting phase".  My husband says I'll be fine and if they were really worried they would have sent me to get tested instead of  being instructed to wait.  I know he is trying to be optimistic and positive and I appreciate that.  But in the quiet times when I am alone I can't bare the thought of what's to come.  I have two little, little girls and the thought of  cancer scares the CRAP out of me!  As it does everyone I know.  Beesie, thank you for explaining to me why I should wait until my next period.  I will go in on July 24th to see the doctor and go from there.  If she says it's just fib. changes I will ask to have an ultrasound to be sure.  I thank you all for giving me advice and information.  I don't feel so helpless and in the dark.  I now feel like I have some sort of plan.  Many thanks!
Posts.Title: Worried and waiting mom2girls mom2girls

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 12:56PM - edited Jun 29, 2008 01:07PM by mom2girls Hi again, So as you can see I have not stopped worrying. And I am probably getting ahead of myself.  But, I want to be sure I am playing an active role in a possible diagnosis.  If I go in and the doctor OK's an ultraound and they decide the lump is there and is not fib. changes.  Is a biopsy next?  Will the dr automatically request a biposy?  Or will I have to push for it? Thanks, Jessica

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2008 03:54PM mom2girls wrote: Britni, I wish you all the best tomorrow.  I will be thinking about you and hoping for a speedy procedure.  Jessica

Posts.Content: mom2girls wrote: Hi, I was told a week ago that I have fibrocystic changes after finding a lump in one of my breasts.  I am going back on July 24th to check and see if the lump is still there.  As of yesterday (7-2-08) I have started having a pinching, burning sensation in my underarm area that kind of goes down my arm(same side as lump).  Is this pain normal with fib. changes?  I am wondering if it is related to the lump or if it could be a symptom of something else.  I am not researching it on the internet because I know I will only find things that will make my waiting even more difficult. I guess I'll just wait until my appt. in 3 weeks to let the doctor know about this new development.  Thanks for any input, Jessica  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Does fibrosytic changes= underarm pain? mom2girls HeatherBLocklear

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2008 08:32PM mom2girls wrote: Hi, I wondered about "fibrosystic changes".  Because the nurse practioner said that's what I have based soley on her feeling lump. I just didn't feel great comfort in her diagnosis. I am following up with it and am going to insist on an ultrasound.  Because I am a worrier.  I know I won't rest until I know for sure what this lump is. I have heard a lot about the book mentioned above and will check it out.    As far as the pain.  It's very odd.  Yesterday it bothered me off and on all day and today nothing.  I did bring myself to check the lump yesterday and it's still there.  So who knows I guess I just have to wait and see until the 24th.  Thank you both for responding.  All of you ladies are so wonderful! Jessica
